step1.sentence: I've always had a soft spot for stray cats, so I can never walk past one without leaving some food.

step2.story: My grandmother has a soft spot for old jazz records. Every Sunday morning, she plays her vinyl collection and hums along while making pancakes. The scratchy melodies fill the kitchen with a warmth that no modern speaker can replicate.

step3.story: David was known around the office as a strict, no-nonsense manager. He rarely smiled during meetings and never tolerated missed deadlines. But his colleagues discovered he had a soft spot for the rescued dogs at the shelter next door. Every lunch break, he would sneak out with a bag of treats and sit quietly with the shyest ones. One afternoon, a coworker caught him whispering encouragement to a trembling puppy. From that day on, nobody saw David quite the same way — tough on spreadsheets, gentle with strays.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '~에 대해 부드러운 부분을 가지고 있다'라는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 특정 사람, 동물, 또는 사물에 대해 특별한 애정이나 약한 마음을 가지고 있을 때 사용합니다. 이성적으로는 아닐 수 있지만 감정적으로 끌리거나 좋아하는 느낌을 표현합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'soft spot'은 원래 아기의 숨구멍(천문)처럼 연약한 부분을 가리키던 말에서 유래하여, 감정적으로 약해지는 부분, 즉 특별히 좋아하는 대상을 의미하게 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '좋아한다'보다 감정적으로 약해진다는 뉘앙스가 있습니다. 평소 냉정한 사람도 특정 대상 앞에서는 마음이 무른다는 느낌으로 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She has a soft spot for chocolate cake — she orders it at every restaurant.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 초콜릿 케이크를 유난히 좋아해서 어느 레스토랑에서든 꼭 주문한다.
